# Diodes Application

<span style="color:#c00000"> __Half  Wave \(HW\) and Full wave Rectifiers__ </span>

Electricity from utility companies is mostly in form of alternating current \(AC\)\, even though most electronic systems require direct current\.

Through a process known as  <span style="color:#0000cc">rectification</span> \, the AC current is converted to DC current\.

Rectification is one of the most common  uses of diodes\.

Rectifier is also called an   <span style="color:#3333cc">AC\-DC converter\.</span>

![](l3.2-diode-circuits-analysis-img/l32-diode-circuits-analysis_1.png)

Rectifier \(ac\-dc converter\)

Explain the process as a self regulated system

The process of  <span style="color:#0000cc">removing one\-half of the  input ac signal </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">to </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">establish </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">a </span>  <span style="color:#0000cc">dc level </span> is  called half\-wave rectification\.

<span style="color:#c00000"> __Peak Inverse \(PIV\) Voltage for Half and Full Wave Rectifiers__ </span>

Also known as peak reverse voltage \(PRV\)\.

It is the voltage rating that must not be exceeded in the reverse\-bias region\, or the diode will enter the Zener avalanche region\.

Very important parameter in design of diode circuits\.

The reverse breakdown voltage rating of the diode should be high enough to withstand the peak\, reverse\-biasing AC voltage\.

<span style="color:#ff0000">If </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _n >_ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> 1\, the secondary voltage is greater than the primary voltage\.</span>

<span style="color:#ff0000"> If </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _n<_ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000">1\, the secondary voltage is less than the primary voltage\. </span>

<span style="color:#ff0000">If </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _n _ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000">= 1\, then </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _Vsec_ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _ _ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000">= </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000"> _Vpri_ </span>  <span style="color:#ff0000">\, and the transformer is referred to as an isolation transformer\.</span>

__Transformer coupling provides two advantages:__
